solution.text:
Let the number of the marbles Anil have be x.
and the number of the marbles Sunil have be y.
Therefore,
Sum of the marbles : x + y = _{{i+j}}_
i.e., y = _{{i+j}}_ - x ----eq.(1)
Similarly, Product of the marbles : \(x\times y = _{{i*j}}_\) -----eq.(2)
Now, substitute value of y from eq(1) to eq.(2)
Therefore:
i.e., \(x\times (_{{i+j}}_-x) = _{{i*j}}_\)
i.e., \(_{{i+j}}_x - x^2 = _{{i*j}}_\)
i.e., \(_{{i+j}}_x - x^2 - _{{i*j}}_ = 0\)
i.e., \(x^2 - _{{i+j}}_x + _{{i*j}}_ = 0\)
i.e., \(x^2 - _{i}_x - _{j}_x + _{{i*j}}_ = 0\)
i.e., \(x(x - _{i}_) - _{j}_(x - _{i}_) = 0\)
i.e., \((x - _{i}_)\times (x - _{j}_) = 0\)
i.e., x = _{i}_ and x = _{j}_
Therefore here we have two possibilities.
Thus, Anil and Sunil can have _{i}_ and _{j}_ marbles respectively,
Similarly,
They can also have _{j}_ and _{i}_ marbles respectively.

content.text: Two brothers Anil and Sunil, both of them have certain number of marbles.If sum and product of the marbles they both have are _{{i+j}}_ and _{{i*j}}_ respectively.Find the number of marbles Anil and Sunil have individually.
